description: From Middle French genereux, and its source, Latin generōsus (“of noble birth”), from genus (“race, stock”).

adjectives.description: generous (comparative more generous, superlative most generous)

entries.meaning: Noble in behaviour or actions; principled, not petty; kind, magnanimous. [from 16th c.]
examples: Thank you for your generous words.

entries.meaning: Willing to give and share unsparingly; showing a readiness to give more (especially money) than is expected or needed. [from 17th c.]
examples: She's been extremely generous with her winnings.

entries.meaning: Large, more than ample, copious. [from 17th c.]
examples: Add a generous helping of mayonnaise.
